B.S. in Computer Science with Concentration in Bioinformatics

The B.S. offers a broad core of computing subjects and allows in-depth study in one of seven concentrations. Students in the Bioinformatics concentration will learn about methods and software tools used to turn biological data into knowledge.  The major focus is on DNA, the molecule that provides the building plan for all living things. Bioinformatics provides the computational toolkit to help you read the book of life. The applications are enormous, from health care, to agriculture, to the environment, and the opportunities in this field are limitless.
